sup all
i just received my wii. it already came presoftmodded. im new to softmodding and have a lot of reading up to do. but right now i just want to play some games. so im about to go to the store to buy an external HDD (WD Passport). and im wondering if i need to pick up an SD card aswell. do i need one for installing homebrew and modifying stuff or will a USB HDD be enough?
also, i have already experienced that back-up dvd's run at slower speeds and can cause stuttering. if i rip these backup games to HDD, will that stop the stuttering?
Austin: ha!
yes
!rules
to both?
bor: an sd card makes it easier but is not needed per se, but I'd highly recommend getting one since none of the guides tell you how to boot without one
also, for certain steps the sd card is required, so if you ran into one of those, you'd need one no matter
alright, i doubt i will do much modifying to my system tho, as its a korean box and i read they are easiest to brick
ie. you can setup homebrew channel and others to use a harddisk but you can only install homebrew channel from SD
ah i see
they are just as easy to brick as any other wii, if you use an US update on a korean wii, that's a brick. If you use EU update on a US wii, that's a brick
the thing is just that so many people try to install US firmware on korean wiis
mkay
i have US firmware on it i think
or english firmware
there is an English hack, but it's still korean firmware inside
doubt the korean version will come with an english language pack
ah
and ehm, what file system for the HDD do you recommend?
fat32 so that homebrew channel can work with it
ntfs is read-only and wbfs is isos-only
but that has filesize limitations
so if you want to NOT use an sd card you will need fat32
and i already saw that super smash bros for example is 7GB
isos on the disk are stored in .wbfs files which are split in chunks of 1-2GB
USB Loader GX is installed on it already
but of course you're right, some people recommend ntfs to get around the 2GB limitation, but no wii app can write to ntfs
if i install games with that, will that auto split the games in parts?
depends on the version, most people here recommend using cfgloader instead of GX
k
any risks of bricking the box if i connect it to the internet?
obv i wont install a new firmware when prompted
but other than that, any risks?
firmware 4.3 doesn't allow you to disable auto updating anymore, but if that wii has 4.3 you'll run into many other problems anyway, I doubt anyone with a sane mind would install 4.3 on a softmodded wii
i think i have 4.1
it said 4.1u in the wii settings menu anyway
that's what you'd end up with when following most of the existing guides, yes
oh?
4.1u is the US firmware, I wonder what the previous owner did to install that without bricking
it came from a shop in bangkok, he didnt speak much english ;)
how do i install the games on the HDD anyway. is it just a matter of dragging the ISO's from my computer to the HDD, plug it into my wii and run USB Loader GX to install? or do i need a WBFS manager?
wbfs manager is for wbfilesystem formatted drives, wii backup manager is for fat/ntfs
cool thanks
will read up on that
both gx and cfgloader can dump actual disks to the drive too if it's writable (not ntfs)

NUSD: http://wiibrew.org/wiki/NUSD
04+770 Health
NUS Downloader, or NUSD, is a PC Utility designed to allow easy access to the resources present on Nintendo's Update Servers. Using this tool, you can download, pack, and decrypt many system titles into WADs ready to install.
04+30 Health Regen (per 5)
04Passive 	 Permanently gain 3.6 Health and .5 Health Regen per 5 sec per minion kill. Champion kills grant 36 Health and 5 Health Regen per 5 sec. Bonuses cap at +450 Health, and +62.5 Health Regen per 5.

13LOL
It should be a red card
There's three types of fouls in FIFA: careless, reckless, and excessive force
Careless == overstepping fair play
Reckless == acted with complete disregard to the safety or consequences of the player
Excessive force == far exceeding the necessary use of force and is in danger of injuring the other player
No card for the first, yellow for the second, red for the third
Now:

But we have the luxury of high speed cameras, and we know that the player was trying to take him out

A mathematician, a biologist and a physicist are sitting in a street cafe watching people going in and coming out of the house on the other side of the street. First they see two people going into the house. Time passes. After a while they notice three persons coming out of the house.
The physicist: "One of the two measurements wasn't very accurate."
The biologist: "They have reproduced".

1. NO PIRACY (or back-ups, don't go pretending, they are the same thing)! We're happy to help with getting the latest emulator to work but you'll be kicked (or banned) if you ask where to get ROMs etc. How to install VC / WiiWare games or asking where to get them will get you an instant ban as will asking for .ISOs or asking on support for modchips or any other piracy or backup-related topics.

smash stack?
!wb Smash Stack
Smash Stack: http://wiibrew.org/wiki/Smash_Stack
Smash Stack is an exploit from Comex that uses a flaw in the custom stages in Super Smash Bros. Brawl (NTSC) to load unauthorized code on the Wii. It was released on August 20, 2009. It works for all System Menu versions.
!wb Indiana Pwns
Indiana Pwns: http://wiibrew.org/wiki/Indiana_Pwns
The Indiana Pwns is a safe way to enable homebrew on a Wii without hardware modification. The Indiana Pwns is achieved by playing a hacked game save for LEGO Indiana Jones which executes a homebrew application from an external SD card. Examples of such homebrew .elf or .dol files can be found on the List of homebrew applications|Homebrew applications page. The Indiana Pwns was created by Team Twiizers.
Smash Stack is NTSC Smash Bros only
Indiana Pwns is PAL/NTSC Indiana Jones

and dont have indiana jone

NUSD: http://wiibrew.org/wiki/NUSD
Galaxy|, so WADs used in that tutorial may be fine?
NUS Downloader, or NUSD, is a PC Utility designed to allow easy access to the resources present on Nintendo's Update Servers. Using this tool, you can download, pack, and decrypt many system titles into WADs ready to install.
^ is one such good example of a proper use for them

depends on what its installing

14Epicness music right there
Google was quite simple - it searches for keywords in relation linking to specific pages. If a page mentions this keyword close or within a link to another page, this linked page is noted as a possible result for this word
07the only personal info that matters is for things like passwords
the more possible results this page gets for a single word, the more likely is the match
that's how Google works - essentially

7Sorry, we can't find "www.mfi.re". We suggest that you check the spelling of the web address or search above.
MediaFire fails... http://www.mediafire.com/?g67uiaop8ub1qab
7Ah, those layers?
Yes.
7Problem is if you have, let's say, a quarter-rest, quarter rest, quarter rest, and a quarter note. On another layer, you have quarter rest, quarter rest, quarter rest, eighth rest, and eighth note.
7Or if you want, fill in one set of quarter rests with notes.
Well... there is a nice way of getting around the problem... for a print out.
One simple hides one set of rests and then just moves the other rests downward/upward to fill the blanks.
7Hides, eh?
Yep.
7How? o.o
In a different piece I've arranged (W. Byrd's "The Bells [Of Osney]" there are measures that call for a third layer... for a single note... so yay H key. :P )
7o.o
In F2007 all you need to do to hide a note/rest is have it selected is just hit the 'H' key.
7That's not working on PrintMusic. O_o
Hmm... time for the manual?
7http://www.finalemusic.com/UserManuals/PrintMusic2010Win/PrintMusic_Left.htm#CSHID=9501|SkinName=NewWindow <-- dah?

PROTO
:D
at first i wanted to see how many bans you could set per MODE
then how large the ban masks could be made
Aah
then it turned into figure out the size of the banlist and propogation
i learned that only the first 101 bans propogate between servers
after that, a channel becomes desynchronized
so, if you want to prevent someone on another server from banning you. fill the banlist with 101 bans first
then their bans wont leave their local server
sort of bugs that were fixed way back in Hybrid 5
not sure what branch this codebase comes from
